Key Match Events: Giannis Antetokounmpo puts up a triple-double with 11 points, 12 rebounds and 13 assists.
RJ Barrett returns to the Raptors' lineup with 25 points and nine rebounds.
Scottie Barnes had 21 points on 10-of-18 shooting.
The Raptors fell behind by 13 in the first quarter and were down by 19 at halftime.
The Raptors lost 128-104 to the Bucks.
The Raptors have lost 13 of their past 14 games.
Giannis Antetokounmpo was held to 11 points, the first time he’s been held below 20 points this season.
The Bucks shot 22-of-44 from deep, while the Raptors shot just 9-of-35.
Pre-Game Insights: Milwaukee Bucks were struggling to stay above .500 and had lost four of their last five games.
Khris Middleton was announced to sit out the game by Bucks head coach Doc Rivers.
The Raptors were finally whole again with all their preferred starters and bench options available.
Post-Match Reflections: Scottie Barnes commented on the loss, stating 'we got beat by 30, so not very well.'
RJ Barrett expressed disappointment in the team's lack of effort, stating 'we just didn’t play hard enough, top to bottom.'
Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic admitted that his team didn’t bring enough fight.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Former Raptor Gary Trent Jr. scored 17 points on 6-of-9 shooting for the Bucks.
Backup centre Bruno Fernando was expected to be waived by the Raptors.
Milwaukee Bucks rookie centre Liam Robbins, nephew of Raptors play-by-play voice Matt Devlin's wife, played six minutes in the fourth quarter.
